name: 1MoreRoom
description:
One More Room is a 2D dungeon crawler where you can choose between different characters and weapons to survive in a dungeon crowded by enemies.

Controls

Although it can be played with both gamepad or keyboard&mouse, it's recommended to use a gamepad if possible.

If you want to use keyboard & mouse, remember to modify the controller settings.

Gamepad
  • Move: left joystick
  • Melee attack: right joystick
  • Shot (with ranged weapons): RT / R2
  • Get object: A / X
  • Pause: Start

Gamepad vibration is only available in downloadable version due to incompatibility with WebGL.

Keyboard & Mouse
  • Move: WASD / arrow keys
  • Melee attack: mouse
  • Shot (with ranged weapon): left click
  • Get object: Space
  • Pause: Esc
Features
  • Unlock new characters: in this beta version you have 3 available characters to choose from plus a secret one. There will be many more characters available and to be unlocked in the full version!
  • Find new weapons: sword, bows, magical staffs, hammers... there's a variety of weapons to discover and there will be many more in the full version!
  • Try and test: every character and weapon has unique features, each one has its own pace and will be favoured by different tactics. Try several combinations and find the one that fits your play style best!
  • Take full control of your weapon: use the right joystick on your gamepad to wield your weapon with complete control whether been melee, ranged or hybrid
  • Improve your skills: along your adventure you will be able to improve your character skills and stats. In the full version there will be many more skills and upgrades to achieve!
Characters & Weapons

Firstly you have to choose an available character. Each one has different attributes:

  • Health: determines the character's health points. You'll be able to recover health by getting potions that you'll find by killing enemies
  • Speed: determines the speed at which the character moves
  • Physical Damage: determines the amount of damage the character will deal when using physical weapons
  • Magical Damage: determines the amount of damage the character will deal when using magical weapons
  • Melee Attack Speed: determines the speed at which the character can swing their weapon
  • Range Attack Speed: determines the speed at which the character can fire with a ranged weapon

When you start your adventure, you'll find several weapons at your disposal and you'll have to choose one of them. Each one has different attributes:

  • Melee Damage Type: indicates the type of damage dealt when weapon is used for a melee attack: physical, magical, both or neither
  • Melee Damage: amount of damage the weapon deals when is used for a melee attack. The total damage that the character can deal with the weapon will be showed in parentheses "( )" 
  • Max Melee Speed: determines maximum speed at which the weapon can be wielded. The speed at which the character can wield that weapon will be showed in parentheses "( )" 
  • Range Damage Type: indicates the type of damage dealt when weapon is used for a ranged attack: physical, magical, both or neither
  • Range Damage: amount of damage the weapon deals when is used for a ranged attack. The total damage that the character can deal with the weapon will be showed in parentheses "( )"
  • Max Range Speed: determines maximum speed at which the weapon can be fired. The speed at which the character can shoot with that weapon will be showed in parentheses "( )"
